main.name: Denesh Kumar
main.description: I'm an aspiring physician passionate about bridging entrepreneurship and technology in a socially responsible manner.
main.bio: Iâ€™m a third year student in the Bachelor of Health Sciences Program at McMaster. I'm passionate about bridging together my interests in biomedical research, machine learning, and entrepreneurship to build evidence-based solutions that can be taken to market in a socially responsible way.

education.description: Studying health sciences through an interdisciplinary lens by understanding health from biological, behavioral and  population-based perspectives.

work.title: Bioinformatics Mentor
work.description: Worked in an interdisciplinary team to create a holistic antisense oligonucleotide (AGO) therapy solution as an improvement versus antibiotic treatment. Developed a stochastic model using GillesPy2 and Numpy to optimize therapy selection by comparing time to failure, mutation rates and entry mechanisms. Visualized bacterial populations using Seaborn heatmaps to provide wetlab researchers an easily understandable guide for decision making

work.title: Full Stack Developer
work.description: Leading development on a platform leveraging natural language processing to summarize news articles using NLTK and Bag-of-Words approach. Building a functional webapp using Python/Django as the backend and Bootstrap for the frontend. Placed in the top 26 out of 147 teams in the National Microsoft AI for Social Impact Competition

work.title: Research Assistant
work.description: Investigating the efficacy of novel treatments for pediatric concussion under Dr. Brian Timmons. Automating data pipeline and visualization in Python with Pandas, Scipy and Matplotlib to analyze accelerometry data. Assisting in conducting patient visits, data entry, data anaylsis, literature review and manuscript writing.

work.title: Android App Developer
work.description: Developed a mobile computer vision application that classified healthy and diseased plants across 33 classes with 90% accruacy using Tensorflow, Keras, Microsoft Azure and Android SDK. Pitched solution to Microsoft executives, placing 4th out of 125 teams in the National Microsoft Discover AI Challenge.

work.title: Consultant | Co-President | Logistics Director
work.description: Led the creation of a 300+ student conference on the future of medicine. Managed ticket sales and sponsor acquisition, donating $10,000 to Sick Kids Hospital. Optimized logisitcs to ensure positive attendee experience.
